definitions.definition: to put your hand or another part of your body lightly onto and off something or someone:
examples: That paint is wet - don't touch (it).

definitions.definition: To show that an illness is not too serious, you can say you have had a touch of it:
examples: I had a touch of flu/hay fever.

definitions.definition: a small addition or detail that makes something better:
examples: The speech had several comic touches.
The weather has turned a touch too cold for my liking.
